notices.title: K34000142: Overview of Route Advertisement
notices.description:
Description

Route Advertisement is a feature of Virtual Addresses whereby their value can be injected in the kernel routing table of the BIG-IP. This is typically used to allow the BIG-IP to make routing decisions based on them and more importantly, advertise them as an address or network out to routing peers so that those remote devices route traffic for that destination to the BIG-IP. With route advertisement, routes can be dynamically added or removed from the BIG-IP's kernel depending on the status of the Virtual Address.

In versions prior to 13, there are only two states, enabled and disabled. The behavior (including how to configure to advertise the information via BGP) can be found in K14267/K15923612.

There are four states a virtual address can be in: Unknown, Enabled, Disabled and Offline. When the virtual address is in Unknown or Enabled state, its route will be added to the kernel routing table. When the virtual address is in Disabled or Offline state, its route will be removed if present and will not be added if not already present.

notices.title: K52494142: GNU C Library (glibc) vlunerability CVE-2016-10228
notices.description: The iconv program in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.31 and earlier, when invoked with multiple suffixes in the destination encoding (TRANSLATE or IGNORE) along with the -c option, enters an infinite loop when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences, leading to a denial of service. (CVE-2016-10228)

notices.title: K96223611: BIND vulnerability CVE-2021-25215
notices.description: In BIND 9.0.0 -> 9.11.29, 9.12.0 -> 9.16.13, and versions BIND 9.9.3-S1 -> 9.11.29-S1 and 9.16.8-S1 -> 9.16.13-S1 of BIND Supported Preview Edition, as well as release versions 9.17.0 -> 9.17.11 of the BIND 9.17 development branch, when a vulnerable version of named receives a query for a record triggering the flaw described above, the named process will terminate due to a failed assertion check. The vulnerability affects all currently maintained BIND 9 branches (9.11, 9.11-S, 9.16, 9.16-S, 9.17) as well as all other versions of BIND 9. (CVE-2021-25215)

K85518341: How/if ASM support the Financial Information eXchange (FIX) protocol?

Description


ASM requires the HTTP profile to be attached to the Virtual Server in order to operate.  The FIX protocol is not HTTP and instead uses the FIX profile on BIG-IP.  ASM does not understand the FIX protocol.

notices.description:
Description


Adding peer device to device trust, GUI shows "This device is not found" error

Basic network connectivity troubleshooting shows no connection to peer device, ping fails with "time to live exceeded"

Local loop interface is shown as the default gateway:

      # ip route get 172.16.23.28
      172.16.23.28 via 127.1.1.253 dev tmm  src 127.1.1.254
          cache  mtu 9282 advmss 9242 hoplimit 64 


Environment
Peer device not in the same subnet

notices.title: K24110403: After Windows 20H1/20H2/21H1 upgrade users are unable to resolve DNS after disconnecting the F5 APM Edge Client
notices.description:
Description

After the Windows 10 20H1, 20H2 or 21H2 in-place upgrades, users may experience a loss of DNS Resolution after using the F5 Edge Client. 
The symptoms of this issue are failures to resolve all DNS queries using ping, nslookup, or while using a web browser. 
Users may experience browser errors relating to DNS:

Microsoft Edge -  Hmmm...can't reach this page
Google Chrome -  DNS_PROBE_FINISHED_NO_INTERNET
Mozilla Firefox - Hmm. We're having trouble finding that site

notices.description:
Description


The Base Registration Key cannot be used to re-activate the license on a device if it is retired. A license key is retired for various reasons.
For instance, the license key is retired for a faulty RMA device. If the retired key is used to activate the license, an error message will appear as below.

Error message: 51079 - Invalid Base Registration Key / Retired status

notices.title: K81414346: How To add/remove resources from APM webtop
notices.description:
Description


BIG-IP Administrators can control what resource/s a particular user or group have access to. This can be done by adding/removing the desired resource/s via the access policy Virtual Policy Editor (VPE)

Once added, for BIG-IP APM deployments utilizing a "Full webtop" use-case, upon successful access policy completion, users will see icons on their APM webtop which represents the resources that have been assigned for their session.

notices.title: Final - K94504224: Apache ZooKeeper vulnerability CVE-2019-0201
notices.description: An issue is present in Apache ZooKeeper 1.0.0 to 3.4.13 and 3.5.0-alpha to 3.5.4-beta. ZooKeeper’s getACL() command doesn’t check any permission when retrieves the ACLs of the requested node and returns all information contained in the ACL Id field as plaintext string. DigestAuthenticationProvider overloads the Id field with the hash value that is used for user authentication. As a consequence, if Digest Authentication is in use, the unsalted hash value will be disclosed by getACL() request for unauthenticated or unprivileged users. (CVE-2019-0201)

notices.title: K08253317: Error message: "012a0000:0: Dataplane INOPERABLE - only 0 HSBes found on this platform" or "012a0000:0: Dataplane INOPERABLE - Only 2 HSBs found. Expected 4"
notices.description:
Description


mcpd does not start properly and /var/log/ltm has similar to below message:

notices.title: K77031520: Unexpected reboot (failover) with power supply issue.
notices.description:
Description


Unexpectedly unit rebooted and failover is initiated.
When you check /var/log/ltm, there is no indication why it is rebooted.
But in /var/log/sel has further information, similar to the below:

notices.title: K19302224: Configure Access Logs in Aspen Mesh
notices.description:
Description
Access Logs are enabled by default for all istio-proxy containers in the Aspen Mesh cluster and are written to the container’s standard output. You can then print the logs using the

notices.title: K36322662: Login history in GUI is empty
notices.description:
Description

When viewing the Login History in the GUI (System  ››  Logins : History) it displays "No Entries", despite audit logging being enabled and user activity showing in /var/log/audit

notices.title: K73550425: Configuration failed to load with error: Failed: name (/Common/dtdi.crt) Cache path (/config/filestore/files_d/Common_d/trust_certificate_d/:Common:dtdi.crt_<Revision ID>) does not exist and there is no copy in trash-bin to restore from
notices.description:
Description

After upgrade, the below message is observed on the Configuration Utility (GUI):

The configuration has not yet loaded. If this message persists, it may indicate a configuration problem.

From CLI, verify the configuration by using the command "tmsh load /sys config verify" and the below error is observed:

notices.title: K50901382: How to mitigate tls-dh-primes on the BIG-IP
notices.description:
Description
Your vulnerability scanner has detected that the BIG-IP is vulnerable to  tls-dh-primes.
